title: Light absorption / emission
subtitle: Absorption & Emission of Photons
about: Discover what happens when a particular frequency of light is absorbed by an atom.
Press the **Play** button to start the radiation source.
Change the **Energy of monochromatic light source** slider to see photons at different energy levels.
To make sure you see all the steps, select the slider and step through the energy levels with the arrow keys.
Wait for at least three series of a photon before moving to the next position.
The atoms will either absorb or let pass photons of each frequency. If the atoms absorb a particular frequency,
they will be excited and get a yellow halo. The atoms will then re-emit the photons.
Which frequency of light is absorbed and re-emitted by these atoms?
Do the re-emitted photons continue in the same direction as the light source?
